### setCompileFunctionCreator() {#a3a59661d11818c97db12857fc12e5c7c}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setCompileFunctionCreator (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljitbuilderstate/#af846158a4c64b54eef46a1fea05ab310">LLJITBuilderState::CompileFunctionCreator</a> CreateCompileFunction)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set a CompileFunctionCreator.

If this method is not called, a default creation function wil be used that will construct a basic IR compile function that is compatible with the selected number of threads (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/simplecompiler">SimpleCompiler</a> for &#39;0&#39; compile threads, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/concurrentircompiler">ConcurrentIRCompiler</a> otherwise).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00419">419</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setJITTargetMachineBuilder() {#a864eff24ba41102940ab527411f2e1a1}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setJITTargetMachineBuilder (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jittargetmachinebuilder">JITTargetMachineBuilder</a> JTMB)</>}

Set the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jittargetmachinebuilder">JITTargetMachineBuilder</a> for this instance.

If this method is not called, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jittargetmachinebuilder/#aa67d14db111b10a6a09cb70fa5f4e084">JITTargetMachineBuilder::detectHost</a> will be used to construct a default target machine builder for the host platform.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00363">363</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.

### setLinkProcessSymbolsByDefault() {#a03b8623cebbf8db82fe51e09fb9aef22}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setLinkProcessSymbolsByDefault (bool LinkProcessSymbolsByDefault)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
The LinkProcessSymbolsDyDefault flag determines whether the &quot;Process&quot; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> will be added to the default link order at <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljit">LLJIT</a> construction time.

If true, the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process">Process</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> will be added as the last item in the default link order. If false (or if the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process">Process</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> is disabled via setProcessSymbolsJITDylibSetup) then the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sys/process">Process</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> will not appear in the default link order.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00387">387</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setNotifyCreatedCallback() {#a11621cccb20125d53fecbb04ebe86e63}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setNotifyCreatedCallback (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljitbuilderstate/#a59b39c299260cc98a016c88b7684626e">LLJITBuilderState::NotifyCreatedFunction</a> Callback)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set up a callback after successful construction of the JIT.

This is useful to attach generators to JITDylibs or inject initial symbol definitions.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00453">453</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setNumCompileThreads() {#a76ce6b4b4b67bc1e6f26d146e748ae29}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setNumCompileThreads (unsigned NumCompileThreads)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set the number of compile threads to use.

If set to zero, compilation will be performed on the execution thread when JITing in-process. If set to any other number N, a thread pool of N threads will be created for compilation.

If this method is not called, behavior will be as if it were called with a zero argument.

This setting should not be used if a custom <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executionsession">ExecutionSession</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executorprocesscontrol">ExecutorProcessControl</a> object is set: in those cases a custom <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/taskdispatcher">TaskDispatcher</a> should be used instead.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00470">470</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setObjectLinkingLayerCreator() {#a9431484a847d2729f9a07481255a5db6}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setObjectLinkingLayerCreator (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljitbuilderstate/#a0c814481775a4e5e618bb12624914357">LLJITBuilderState::ObjectLinkingLayerCreator</a> CreateObjectLinkingLayer)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/objectlinkinglayer">ObjectLinkingLayer</a> creation function.

If this method is not called, a default creation function will be used that will construct an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/rtdyldobjectlinkinglayer">RTDyldObjectLinkingLayer</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00407">407</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setPlatformSetUp() {#ab73d2cdea504ee56114cc8a4857d4942}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setPlatformSetUp (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljitbuilderstate/#ae4af55a290a38d4fdc809fcac453ca52">LLJITBuilderState::PlatformSetupFunction</a> SetUpPlatform)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set up an PlatformSetupFunction.

If this method is not called then setUpGenericLLVMIRPlatform will be used to configure the JIT&#39;s platform support.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00443">443</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.

### setPrePlatformSetup() {#a31a54545a741390d14c0a3be51574060}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setPrePlatformSetup (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unique-function">unique&#95;function</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/error">Error</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljit">LLJIT</a> &amp;)&gt; PrePlatformSetup)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set a setup function to be run just before the PlatformSetupFunction is run.

This can be used to customize the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljit">LLJIT</a> instance before the platform is set up. E.g. By installing a debugger support plugin before the platform is set up (when the ORC runtime is loaded) we enable debugging of the runtime itself.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00433">433</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setProcessSymbolsJITDylibSetup() {#af09d70e8bfc7d790640f2e1be1cdf1eb}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setProcessSymbolsJITDylibSetup (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljitbuilderstate/#af756c328268fed9a73465567e66d4c79">LLJITBuilderState::ProcessSymbolsJITDylibSetupFunction</a> SetupProcessSymbolsJITDylib)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Set a setup function for the process symbols dylib.

If not provided, but LinkProcessSymbolsJITDylibByDefault is true, then the process-symbols <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/jitdylib">JITDylib</a> will be configured with a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/dynamiclibrarysearchgenerator">DynamicLibrarySearchGenerator</a> with a default symbol filter.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00396">396</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### setSupportConcurrentCompilation() {#ae21f57fe6141499a35b81f27bd3e9a6f}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename JITType, typename SetterImpl, typename State&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>SetterImpl &amp; llvm::orc::LLJITBuilderSetters&lt; JITType, SetterImpl, State &gt;::setSupportConcurrentCompilation (std::optional&lt; bool &gt; SupportConcurrentCompilation)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
If set, this forces <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/lljit">LLJIT</a> concurrent compilation support to be either on or off.

This controls the selection of compile function (concurrent vs single threaded) and whether or not sub-modules are cloned to new contexts for lazy emission.

If not explicitly set then concurrency support will be turned on if NumCompileThreads is set to a non-zero value, or if a custom <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executionsession">ExecutionSession</a> or <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/orc/executorprocesscontrol">ExecutorProcessControl</a> instance is provided.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h/#l00483">483</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/executionengine/include/llvm/executionengine/orc/lljit-h">LLJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
